title: Friday, 17th May 2019
bodyHTML:
VV75 morning
11:06 am
JP11:06am

You know it makes sense, don't even think about it
Life and death, and markets, are just things you do when you're bored...

JP11:06am

Blank canvas good morning all
DRichi Good morning

(Morning all.)

AMALtd hi

JP11:06am

J Chisholm Soundby, you are speaking my language

In typical Bitcoin fashion. I could speculate that it seems the latest rise is just another pump and dump engineered by insiders, but that would be too obvious wouldn't it?

Patience Good morning.
VV75 obvious but true

Interesting development: Cryptocompare, which I got that screenshot from, is now listing all its coins in Tether as standard. Rather than USD.

@Mafiosi -- Teeth smileTeeth smileTeeth smile

red crypto still living off selling the idea that folks with nought can become folks with something.

Right, onto the slightly more serious side of markets.

11:13 am
JP11:13am

@red -- aren't we all living off that dream?

JP11:13am

Let's start with the obvious one, just to get it out the way.

Metro Bank PLC (MTRO:LSE): Last: 631.00, up 94.5 (+17.61%), High: 668.00, Low: 608.50, Volume: 1.74m
red @JPin fiat terms its quite hard to do these days given high prices. but crypto sellers the bedsitters or basement homies a dream
11:14 am

Metro Bank got its share placing through at a 5% discount to close price, versus the 10% chatter yesterday, and in larger size -- £375m.

JP11:15am

Here's the press release:

JP11:15am

https://otp.tools....352&newsid=1265695

red u need some to make some. for crypto in theory, the sell, u don't. thats the key to pulling in more suckers
11:15 am
JP11:16am

BoE have also thrown its weight behind the bank, saying that it "continues to have adequate capital and liquidity to serve its current customer base".

VV75 funny how thy call a placing, on close to all-time low, a strong event
JP11:16am

via the FT: https://www.ft.com...-bbad-7c18c0ea0201

JP11:16am

@VV75 -- Deliveroo/ JustEat coming up.

A. M. (Morning all, greetings from sunny Oslo)
Soundbuy Waste of time BE emptying his safe deposit boxes this week then...........a week he won't get back
Flaneur Louis Theroux on R4 this morn (DID) - some interesting music there.
11:17 am
JP11:17am

However, this morning also brings news that one of its major shareholders, Legal and General Investment Management, are not happy.

JP11:17am

Planning to vote against the chair.

JP11:17am

https://www.ft.com...-be7d-6d846537acab

11:17 am
JP11:18am

Not sure it will achieve, but yay, corporate governance. Shame it's after a precipitous fall in the share price.

JP11:18am

But there we go.

JP11:18am

Here's Barclays:

11:18 am
JP11:18am

We update for the increased £375m accelerated book build, which comes at a lower price and is more dilutive than we expected. We welcome colour on cost saves, but there's no change to guidance or targets and we leave earnings estimates unchanged. We cut EPS/PT on higher share count, and retain our cautious stance, given a weak operating outlook, and our expectations of further capital injections beyond 2019, and un-compelling valuation. Key points following the book build:

JP11:18am

We expect the increased £375m equity raise to go through:Metro built (and increased) a book overnight at a 500p buy-in price, boosting Q1 CET1 by an estimated 380bp to 15.9%, but increasing share count by 77% (lowering TNAV by c25%). Shareholder approval is required, which we expect Metro to obtain, given investor interest regarding price/structure is likely to have been canvassed in advance. The deal is fully underwritten (we estimate £10m fees).

JP11:19am

How will funding spreads react? Key for us will be whether funding spreads narrow enough following the raise, with Metro reiterating its intention to issue £500m MREL-compliant debt in 2H19, which currently looks prohibitively expensive. Obtaining a credit rating could also help. As could potential loan sales – which could help delay the need for more equity injection if Metro can get a good price.

hornblower good work from the Metro brokers to get the placing done at 500p
11:18 am
JP11:19am

Welcome detail on cost saves, but no change to guidance/targets: Metro has quantified gross target cost savings vs. their original plans, but it's not enough for us to change our earnings estimates. We are c30% below Refinitv consensus PBT.

JP11:19am

Further deposit outflows, which appear isolated: Following recent press speculation, Metro suffered deposit outflows between 10th and 13th May, although this is stabilising. Key will be understanding any lingering impacts on the business.

JP11:20am

Share price target of 537p there, so 15 per cent or so below where we are after today's price action.

VV75 government talks end without brexit deal
11:20 am
JP11:20am

@Soundbuy -- BE's safety deposit box. Let's not speculate as to what's in there.

JP11:21am

(There's Brexit stuff but I can't be bothered, unless ROTR is desperate.)

red @VV75no surprises there.
JP11:21am

On Metro, further stuff from Morgan Stanley:

11:21 am
JP11:21am

Metro has announced a £350m share offering at a fixed price of 500p or a c.9%
discount. Given a large short base, we could see some pricing support tomorrow,
though we remain cautious on the longer-term outlook,as we recently outlined
in our note "The end of the free money era in the UK",as TFS rolls and MREL
requirements rise.
The capital raise follows on from the RWA accounting mis-interpretation
announced at the end of January, which saw CET1 fall by c.300bps. Today's
placement should result in profroma CET1 rise c.350bps to 15.6% from 12.1% as
at Q1. Metro has reiterated its intention to raise £500m in MREL by year end.
There is additional commentary in the prospectus and presentation that is worth
highlighting:

JP11:22am

1. During Q1, the bank reported that deposits had fallen c.£500m or 4% QoQ,
due to the accounting mis-interpreation, but management that they had
stabilised in March and returned to growth in April.Following press reports
regardingnegative social media commentary last weekend, the bank notes in the
prospectus, that "Metro Bank experienced a short period of depositnet outflows
following the intense press speculation between 10 and 13 May 2019. The
position is stabilising." The bank reiterates that longer-term deposit growth is
expected to be c.20%, though growth in 2019 will be below this level.

PBateman morning, sorry for the tardiness
JP11:22am

2. Metro has provided more colour around cost saves it plans over the next 3
years. Ithas identified c.£100m cost saves (as per the FY18 guidance), buthas
split this out between Opex (c.£55-60m) and Capex (£40-45m). It expects to
deliver £15-19m of this by end 2019. Together with earnings growth, it expects to
reach a 55-60% C/I by 2023. MSe C/I is 69% in 2023e.
3. According to the presentation released, then the LCR is at 142%,vs 139% as at
the end of 2018. Deposit balances fell c.£500m QoQ, while repo balances
increased.

PBateman Just Eat PLC would be a request from me, please
11:22 am
JP11:22am

Bullish -- price target 830p.

JP11:22am

No worries @PBateman, another late night at Dorsia?

JP11:23am

And to round things off on everyone's favourite bank to deposit copper coins in...Panmure:

11:23 am
JP11:23am

Following the announcement of a committedstandby underwrite in place with certain banks on 26thFebruary 2019, Metro Bank has raised £375m(£25m more than intended)through the issue of new shares each at 500p (5% discount to closing price). Managementhavereiterated their FY2019 guidance although Metro Bank experienced a short period of deposit net outflows following social media speculation between 10 and 13 May 2019. Hence, a more modest deposit growth is expected in 2019 before transitioning into c.20%growth. Post the weak 1Q19 update, we reduce our NIM, deposit and loan growth forecasts resulting in FY2021E falling by 1.1ppt to 6.4%.Due to this and the higher than expected share dilution, we maintain our SELL rating and reduce our TP to 445p (from 715p).

JP11:24am

Capital position improved but significant share dilution–The £375m share placing will improve the CET1 ratio from 12.1% to c.16.0% with theleverage ratio at c.6.7% but the share dilution is much higher as we had previously anticipated sharesbeingplaced at 700p implying 50m new shares compared to 75m announced. This in conjunction with lowering our forecasts results in a 38% target pricereduction.Deposit outflows imply further slow growth–Deposits in 1Q19 fell by 3.6% QoQ to £15.1bn following the mis-reporting of RWAs in January resulting in LTD ratio rising by 9ppt to 100%. Although deposit growth resumed in April, social media speculation regarding the health of the bank last weekend has ledtofurther net deposit outflows. Indeed, management now expect more modest deposit growth in 2019 with the expectation of achieving target 20% growth after 2019.

FATDAZ @JP re Metro the powers that be said that about HBOS back in the day I seem to recall
JP11:25am

But FY2019 guidance reiterated–However, despite weak deposits, 2019 guidance is reiterated. In particular: [1] 8 new stores in 2019, plus two C&I funded stores;[2] Manage its LDR in a measured wat towards its medium-term target of 85-90%;[3] Cost income ratio is expected to be at upper end of 85-90% range [1Q19: 91.5%]. Given worries of deposit flight we now believe 2019 growth will be more muted. Reducing TP to 445p and maintain SELL rating–Deposit worries coupled with a weak 1Q19 trading update which highlighted continued weakness in NIM and profitabilitymean we reduce our FY2021E RoTE by 1.1ppt to 6.4%. And with our TNAVPS falling by 15% due to greater share dilution, we reduce our TP by 38% to 445p. Although Metro Bank trades on P/TBV of 0.6x we expect low returns over the next two years.

11:25 am
JP11:25am

Sell rating too, price target: 445p.

JP11:26am

What a week for Metro eh? Deposit-gate at the weekend, now this.

JP11:27am

Right, what else?

@red -- yep same business model.

JP11:36am

@Forester - wut.

Joesph H Zoap. The local curry joint I occasionally order from has a 3 section fold out double sided take away menu. JE. needs 42 pages to impart the exact same info.
JP11:37am

Anyway, it seems some are worried. It's hard to compete with a business selling its product to consumers below cost.

11:37 am
JP11:37am

Here's Peel Hunt:

JP11:37am

Amazon boosts Deliveroo in $575m raise

With Amazon pulling out of its restaurants offering in the UK at the end of last year, today this FAANG has demonstrated its view that Deliveroo is a better place to put its money. While Deliveroo is still in its pre-profit (strategically loss making) phase, as it invests for growth, if any company knows about the benefit of that strategy it is Amazon. After Uber’s IPO last week that raised $8.1bn and now Amazon’s investment today – both in aid of the more expensive delivery side of the takeaway market – these two FAANG(U)s will put more pressure on Just Eat which has only recently started out on that journey. Reiterate Sell.

Forester Sorry, I mean Deliveroo are quite literally burning cash!
JP11:37am

Q: when does a company stop being strategically loss making?

11:37 am
JP11:38am

A: when rates go up.

red seems these days every business model is throwing enough money at something to bankrupt the competition, while throwing an app in there.
Soundbuy As both mentioned this am., quick factoid nicked from twitter:Amazon went public 22 years ago. A $1k investment would be worth $1.2M today.Bitcoin is only 10 years old. A $1k investment would be worth $2.6 BILLION today.
JP11:38am

(Maybe.)

nichoman anything new on thomas cook today ?
Forester ...but I am biased as I loath JE and am a long term Amazon holder.
red @ Soundbuythis is what i mean about the dream selling
JP11:39am

And Liberum, who are a bit more positive about the company:

11:39 am
JP11:39am

Amazon investment will raise concerns...

All the food delivery stocks including peers Takeaway.com (NR) and Delivery Hero (NR) likely to be impacted by the news that Amazon led the funding on the latest £450m raise for food delivery service Deliveroo (Amazon previously has been linked with an outright acquisition of Deliveroo). The fears are that the extra funding will allow Deliveroo to become a more effective competitor and that, if Amazon was to buy deliveroo outright, it would be a formidable customer that would knock out leaders such as Just Eat and the others.

Soundbuy Aye.............
JP11:39am

Those concerns are overdone...

In our view, these fears are overblown and all this move changes in the food delivery space is that it is underpinning Deliveroo's valuation for an IPO (Deliveroo's valuation under the funding was reported to be $3-4bn) or a sale.

The reason why we are so unconcerned is for exactly the same reasons that we highlighted in our Just Eat note last year, namely the food delivery portals model is similar to other classified portals business such as Rightmove and AutoTrader where market leadership is disproportionately important as it creates a virtuous circle of the more advertisers attracting more customers which attract more advertisers etc.

Just Eat is #1 in its markets and, in the UK, it has an estimated x3-4 greater share than Uber Eats and Deliveroo combined and, crucially, 60%+ of its customers are in small towns where it is effectively the only option for restaurants and where the Uber Eats / Deliveroo model just doesn't work because of the economics.

FATDAZ @soundbuy think that undervalues amazon but its an interesting comparative
JP11:40am

The final point is an important one. Probably the most important one. If Deliveroo can't get its economics going in major cities, how are they going to compete in the regions?

FATDAZ @nichoman Citi have a note out
11:40 am
JP11:40am

What is more likely is that Just eat (and others) will be acquired

With these types of classified portals markets, trying to win leadership by organic spending makes little sense whatsoever as it requires the challenger to break consumer habits. It is quite simply better to acquire the market leader. Thus we think that market leaders such as Just Eat, Delivery Hero and Takeaway.com are likely to become targets with several possible buyers. One possibility is Uber (NR), which we think will eventually realise that trying to gatecrash its way into these markets only leads to significant losses (although, in several markets, there will be competition issues). Another are US food delivery groups looking to expand internationally, such as GrubHub (NR) and DoorDash, which is reportedly looking at a $10-12bn IPO. A third possibility is Amazon (NR), although it seems unusually hesitant in leaping into the market. Finally, and we think most likely, we would watch out for when the spin-off of Naspers' (NR) classifieds business happens in 2H and whether that vehicle looks to make acquisitions in this space.

red yes may only work in biggest cities
Soundbuy @FATDAZ .........I can understand that........
JP11:41am

Price target of 1360p based on a DCF.

JP11:47am

Excel Developer Is Thomas Cook, down to hard Brexit re Boris?
JP11:48am

That is nasty.

BornCynic JP - Still waiting for Lloyd Blankfein to be struck by lightning for that one.........
JP11:48am

FATDAZ has kindly sent over the note from Citi.

11:48 am
JP11:49am

Here it is:

JP11:51am

(ffs, technical issue, one mo)

JP11:51am

We see option value only remaining in TCG’s equity. The outlook for FY19 was
significantly weaker than expected with guidance for underlying EBIT in 2H19 below
2H18. We cut our underlying FY19E EBIT forecast from £221m to £163m [-26%]
which drives underlying EPS -74% to 1.2p.

11:51 am
JP11:51am

This excludes assumed £87m of SDIs
and £1,104m goodwill impairment. We continue to apply 4x and 5x FY19E EBIT
multiples for the Tour Op and Airline businesses which points to EV of £738m.

Electric Dragon @Soundbuy good luck on getting that $2.6bn. Anyone with that much BTC and trying to sell would crater the market. (If they even still had them given MtGox, QuadrigaCX, Binance et al.)
Soundbuy @ED - if only.............
JP11:53am

Guidance that FY net debt will increase by a similar amount as the 1H18 - 1H19 move - £361m - points to FY18E net debt of c £750m - Citi £740m - and implies zero equity value.

JP11:53am

We move to Sell and cut our target price to 0p [from 28p], see inside.

11:53 am
JP11:53am

Risk of a vicious circle. We fear that news of the £1.0bn write down and the
“material uncertainties” comment from the auditors will unsettle consumers and drive further weakness in bookings (currently -12%). Although the group has long- standing hotel partners which have been supportive we fear that further weakness in the bonds/shares may also cause them to seek to tighten payment terms.

JP11:54am

“Material uncertainties” exist. Like the auditors we see material uncertainties around the airline sale and the new debt facilities. We value the airline at 5x EBIT, an EV of £592m or equity of £360m (after airline related debt). We struggle to see the group receiving a high enough offer to prevent the deal being dilutive to earnings (see inside). We note that new £300m credit facilities are not yet committed and “dependent on progress in executing the strategic review of the airline”. Although management commented that this does not mean they have to sell the airline to access the facility, the lenders appear to have room to walk away.

JP11:54am

Bonds at c50% of face value. Debt markets are clearly highlighting the risk of financial distress and a debt for equity swap or substantial rights issue are both probable outcomes in our view. A highly priced airline disposal could alleviate near term pressures and free the way for an offer for the remainder from a non-EU entity (eg Fosun as reported by FT) which could leave some option value in the shares.

11:54 am
JP11:55am

I think this is the first time I've seen a target price of 0p.
